intro: Didyplosandra lanceolata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf didyplosandra, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for coastal gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its evergreen foliage and seasonal blooms.
